斷.definition: to break; to snap; to cut off; to give up or abstain from sth; to judge; (usu. used in the negative) absolutely; definitely; decidedly

斷乳.definition: to wean; to be weaned; (TCM) to use medication to stop lactation

斷交.definition: to end a relationship; to break off diplomatic ties

斷供.definition: to default on a mortgage; to stop supplying sth

斷句.definition: to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing; to punctuate

斷垣殘壁.definition: lit. walls reduced to rubble (idiom); fig. scene of devastation; ruins

斷壁殘垣.definition: lit. walls reduced to rubble (idiom); fig. scene of devastation; ruins

斷壁頹垣.definition: lit. walls reduced to rubble (idiom); fig. scene of devastation; ruins

斷子絕孫.definition: to die without progeny; (offensive) may you die childless; may you be the last of your family line

斷定.definition: to conclude; to determine; to come to a judgment

斷尾.definition: (zoology) (of a lizard etc) to shed its tail; to autotomize its tail; (animal husbandry) to cut the tail short; to dock the tail

斷層.definition: fault (geology) (CL:道[dao4]); (fig.) gap; rupture (in the transmission of some skill); (tomography) cross-sectional

斷崖式.definition: (of a fall in price, temperature etc) steep; precipitous

斷弦.definition: widowed; lit. broken string, cf 琴瑟[qin2 se4] qin and se, two instruments epitomizing marital harmony

斷捨離.definition: (neologism c. 2012) decluttering; minimalism (orthographic borrowing from Japanese 断捨離 "danshari", lit. "forgoing, discarding and letting go")

斷斷續續.definition: intermittent; off and on; discontinuous; stop-go; stammering; disjointed; inarticulate

斷橋.definition: The Broken Bridge (at West Lake in Hangzhou)

斷檔.definition: sold out; to be out of stock

斷氣.definition: to stop breathing; to breathe one's last; to die; to cut the gas supply

斷港絕潢.definition: to be unable to continue; to come to a dead end (idiom)

斷片.definition: fragment; piece; (of a film) to break in the middle of viewing

斷片兒.definition: (coll.) to suffer an alcohol-induced blackout; to be unable to recall what one did while drunk

斷獄.definition: to pass judgment on a legal case

斷球.definition: (sports) to steal; to intercept the ball

斷瓦殘垣.definition: the tiles are broken, the walls dilapidated

斷生.definition: (of food) to be cooked just until no longer raw

斷碼.definition: (fashion retailing) available only in a limited range of less popular sizes

斷網.definition: to cut off access to the Internet; to shut down the Internet

斷線.definition: (of a guitar, kite etc) to have a string break; (of a tradition etc) to be discontinued; (telephone or Internet connection) disconnected; cut off

斷線風箏.definition: a kite that is lost after its string breaks (metaphor for sb one never hears from anymore)

斷背.definition: homosexual (a reference to Brokeback Mountain 斷背山|断背山[Duan4 bei4 Shan1], a 2005 movie about a same-sex relationship)

斷背山.definition: Brokeback Mountain, 2005 English-language film by Ang Lee 李安[Li3 An1]

斷袖.definition: homosexual; see 斷袖之癖|断袖之癖[duan4 xiu4 zhi1 pi3]

斷袖之癖.definition: lit. cut sleeve (idiom); fig. euphemism for homosexuality, originating from History of Western Han 漢書|汉书: emperor Han Aidi (real name Liu Xin) was in bed with his lover Dong Xian, and had to attend a court audience that morning. Not wishing to awaken Dong Xian, who was sleeping with his head resting on the emperor's long robe sleeve, Aidi used a knife to cut off the lower half of his sleeve.

斷送.definition: to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc); ruined

斷開.definition: to break; to sever; to turn off (electric switch)

斷電.definition: to experience a power outage; to have a power failure

斷頓.definition: to go without meals (due to poverty or scarcity)

斷魂椒.definition: king cobra or ghost chili (Naga jolokia)
